intro: Corynandra pulchella, commonly known as the pretty corynandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Corynandra pulchella is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
